EventItemTitle:
The City Clerk raps the gavel three times and states:
“I call the Meeting to order.”

The City Clerk states:
“Will the Clerk please read the call for today’s Charter Meeting.”
The Clerk reads:

The City Clerk then states:
“Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the Clerk to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.”
 
The Clerk reads:

The City Clerk will then state:
“I will now perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office.”

The City Clerk will then request:
“Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum.”
After ascertaining from the Clerk that there is a quorum, the City Clerk will then announce:
“We have a quorum.”

The City Clerk will state:
“Please rise for today’s invocation delivered by Minister Jason S. Riffe Abyssinian Baptist Church, 132 Odell Clarke Place, New York, NY 10031”

The City Clerk will recognize Council Member Dickens

Council Member Dickens will make the motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record.

The City Clerk states:
“So ordered.”
The City Clerk will recognize Council Member Dickens:
NOMINATION OF THE SPEAKER
MESSAGES & PAPERS FROM THE MAYOR
PETITIONS & COMMUNICATIONS
The Acting President Pro-Tempore will then recognize the Speaker

Communication from the Speaker
See Attached
RECESS OR ADJOURNMENT

EventItemActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemTitle:
December 19, 2013


Honorable Michael McSweeney
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
141 Worth Street
New York, New York 10013

Dear City Clerk McSweeney:

Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, the Charter meeting of the 2014 Council of the city of New York will be held on Wednesday, January 8, 2014 at 12:00 noon, in the Council Chambers, second floor, City Hall, New York, New York.

Sincerely,


Christine C. Quinn
Speaker

EventItemActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemTitle:
December 12, 2013


Honorable Michael McSweeney
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
141 Worth Street
New York, New York 10013

Dear Mr. McSweeney:

The Commissioners of Elections at their meeting held on Tuesday, December 3, 2013 certified the November 5, 2013 General Election for Members of the City Council.

The Following have been elected:


1st	Margaret S. Chin	
2nd	Rosie Mendez	
3rd	Corey D. Johnson	
4th	Daniel R. Garodnick	
5th	Ben Kallos	
6th	Helen K. Rosenthal	
7th	Mark Levine	
8th	Melissa Mark-Viverito	
9th	Inez E. Dickens	
10th	Ydanis A. Rodriguez	
11th	Andrew Cohen	
12th	Andy L. King	
13th	James Vacca	
14th	Fernando Cabrera	
15th	Ritchie J. Torres	
16th	Vanessa L. Gibson	
17th	Maria Del Carmen Arroyo	
18th	Annabel Palma	
19th	Paul A. Vallone	
20th	Peter A. Koo	
21st	Julissa Ferreras	
22nd	Costa G. Constantinides	
23rd	Mark S. Weprin	
24th	Rory I. Lancman	
25th	Daniel Dromm	
26th	James G. Van Bramer	
27th	I. Daneek Miller	
28th	Ruben Wills	
29th	Karen Koslowitz	
30th	Elizabeth S. Crowley	
31st	Donovan J. Richards	
32nd	Eric A. Ulrich	
33rd	Stephen T. Levin	
34th	Antonio Reynoso	
35th	Laurie A. Cumbo	
36th	Robert E. Cornegy, Jr.	
37th	Rafael  L. Espinal, Jr.	
38th	Carlos Menchaca	
39th	Bradford S. Lander	
40th	Mathieu Eugene	
41st	Darlene Mealy	
42nd	Inez D. Barron	
43rd	Vincent J. Gentile	
44th	David G. Greenfield	
45th	Jumaane D. Williams	
46th	Alan N. Maisel	
47th	Mark Treyger	
48th	Chaim M. Deutsch	
49th	Deborah L. Rose	
50th	Steven Matteo	
51st	Vincent M. Ignizio	

Yours very truly,


Michael J. Ryan
Executive Director
EventItemMatterName: Board of Elections - List of Elected City Officials

EventItemActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
EventItemTitle:
By Council Member Chin:

“Motion that pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 2010-2013 Rules of the Council as amended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or said rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.”
EventItemMatterName: Continuation Of 2010-2013 Rules Of The Council, As Amended

EventItemTitle: ROLL CALL
The City Clerk will announce the results of the vote.

EventItemActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
EventItemTitle:
The City Clerk will then open the floor for nominations for Speaker.
All nominations shall use the following form:

“I hereby nominate for the Office of the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, Pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter, for the term commencing January 1, 2014 and terminating December 31, 2017, Council Member Melissa Mark-Viverito.”

Although not required by the Rules, the City Clerk will ask if there is a second to the nomination.

After the nomination has been seconded the City Clerk will then ask:
“Are there any other nominations?”

If so, the same procedure as listed above shall be followed.

After all nominations have been made the City Clerk will state:
“I now close the nominations.”

The City Clerk will call the roll and announce the results and declare:

“The Council Member duly elected as the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York for the term commencing January 1, 2014 and terminating December 31, 2017 is Council Member Melissa Mark-Viverito.”

At the Speaker’s discretion, the designation of an Acting President Pro-Tempore may be made at this point.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 172-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 172-A, Exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 859-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of crime in all parks and playgrounds within the City that are greater than one acre in size.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 859-A, Requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of crime in all parks and playgrounds within the City that are greater than one acre in size.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 867-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 867-A, Creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 933-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an animal abuse registry.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 933-A, Creating an animal abuse registry.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 1055-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to report information concerning vehicle collisions in which a driver left the scene of the collision.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 1055-A, NYPD to report information concerning vehicle collisions in which a driver left the scene of the collision.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 1208-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of sick time earned by employees.
EventItemMatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 1208-A, Provision of sick time earned by employees.

EventItemActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
EventItemTitle:
We, the undersigned members of the Minority (Republican) Delegation of the Council of the City of New York, hereby designate and appoint Vincent M. Ignizio as Minority Leader of the New York City Council, pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Rules of the Council of the City of New York for a term commencing on January 1, 2014. 
Signed Vincent M. Ignizio, Eric Ulrich, Steven Matteo

EventItemActionText: A motion was made that this Petition be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
EventItemTitle:
By the Speaker:

“I nominate the following Council Members as Members of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections of the City Council:

	    	    Chair:	Council Member Lander

Committee Members:	Speaker Mark-Viverito
Council Member Richards
Council Member Espinal, Jr.
Council Member Chin
Council Member Rose
Council Member Rodriguez 

“For this roll call, the question on the floor is whether the Council would agree with and adopt such nominations.”

The Acting President Pro-Tempore will then state:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll.”

The City Clerk will announce the results of the vote.
EventItemMatterName: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

“I order the call to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.”
